name: src/combinations.js
combinations
description: Yields all combinations of each possible choice of r elements of the input iterable.
examples:
// AB AC AD BC BD CD
combinations('ABCD', 2)

params.name: r
params.description: The size of the combinations to generate.

content:
:hippopotamus: [@combinatorics/n-combinations](https://computational-combinatorics.github.io/n-combinations)
==

Set n-combinations for JavaScript.
See [docs](https://computational-combinatorics.github.io/n-combinations/index.html).

> :building_construction: Caveat emptor! This is work in progress. Code may be
> working. Documentation may be present. Coherence may be. Maybe.

> :warning: Depending on your environment, the code may require
> `regeneratorRuntime` to be defined, for instance by importing
> [regenerator-runtime/runtime](https://www.npmjs.com/package/regenerator-runtime).

```js
import {combinations} from '@combinatorics/n-combinations';

combinations("ABCD", 2); // AB AC AD BC BD CD
combinations(range(4), 3); // 012 013 023 123
```

name: ./README.md
package.json
./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation

Can be managed using
[yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs),
[npm](https://docs.npmjs.com),
or [jspm](https://jspm.org/docs).


### yarn
```terminal
yarn add @combinatorics/n-combinations
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install @combinatorics/n-combinations --save
```

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:@combinatorics/n-combinations
```
